meanings.definition: Showing signs of old age or antiquity
meanings.sent1: The hoariest tree in the forest stood tall and gnarled, its branches twisted with age.
meanings.sent2: The hoariest book in the library was a dusty tome from the 17th century.
meanings.sent3: The hoariest tortoise in the zoo was rumored to have seen the dinosaurs roaming the earth.
meanings.sent4: Her hoariest memories were of a time long gone, filled with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent5: The hoariest ruins of the ancient city still held secrets waiting to be uncovered.

meanings.definition: Covered with a layer of ice or frost
meanings.sent1: The hoariest branches of the tree glistened in the morning sun, coated with frost.
meanings.sent2: The hoariest mornings in winter brought a magical sparkle to the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The hoariest ice sculptures in the park looked like delicate works of art.
meanings.sent4: Her windshield was the hoariest in the neighborhood, requiring extra time to defrost.
meanings.sent5: The hoariest peaks of the mountain range were always the first to be covered in snow.

meanings.sent1: The hoariest jokes at the party were met with polite smiles and forced laughter.
meanings.sent2: His speech was filled with the hoariest phrases, making the audience yawn in boredom.
meanings.sent3: The hoariest romantic comedy followed the same predictable plotline as countless others.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses for being late were the hoariest in the book, always blaming traffic.
meanings.sent5: The hoariest lines in the play were delivered with such exaggerated flair that they became comedic.
